tool_description: Generate realistic fake German personas with complete details like name, gender, phone number, address, date of birth, and social security number.
name: 🔴 GERMANY 🔴 Fake Person / Address
title: 🔴 GERMANY 🔴 Fake Person / Address

api_list.name: random-person
api_list.description:
Generates a complete and realistic fake persona based on German data, including name, gender, phone number, address, date of birth, and social security number.
HTTP Method

GET
Parameters

None
Headers

    Authorization: Your API key (if required)

Rate Limiting

Limited to X requests per minute per user (replace X with your actual rate limit).
Sample Request

http

GET https://api.yourdomain.com/random-person

Sample Response

json

{
  "gender": "male",
  "name": "Michael Schmidt",
  "phone": "+4915253948675",
  "address": {
    "road": "Bahnhofstraße",
    "building_number": "42",
    "postcode": "10115",
    "country": "Deutschland"
  },
  "date_of_birth": "1985-04-23",
  "social_security_number": "12345678901"
}

Response Object

    gender: The gender of the generated persona (male or female).
    name: The full name of the generated persona.
    phone: A valid German phone number.
    address: A nested object containing the street (road), building number (building_number), postal code (postcode), and country (country).
    date_of_birth: The date of birth in YYYY-MM-DD format.
    social_security_number: An 11-digit number mimicking a German tax identification number.

Error Codes

    400 Bad Request: Incorrect request format.
    401 Unauthorized: Invalid API key.
    429 Too Many Requests: Rate limit exceeded.
    500 Internal Server Error: Server-side issues.

Use-Cases

    Application Testing: Quickly generate realistic user profiles for testing.
    Data Filling: Populate databases with fake but believable German personas.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://germany-fake-person-address.p.rapidapi.com/random-person"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "germany-fake-person-address.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

import requests

url = "https://germany-fake-person-address.p.rapidapi.com/random-person"

print(response.json())
